items.title: Defence PSUs outperformed private peers in Q3, says Choice Broking; here's a list of stocks with 'BUY' rating
items.description: 'The quarter underscored the resilience of Defence PSUs in managing global challenges, while private players struggled with operational inefficiencies and supply chain issues,' said Choice Broking.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on February 24
items.description: Key indices end in red with IT as the worst performer while FMCG and Pharma led the gains. The Nifty mid and smallcap indices fell by 1 percent each.

items.title: TCS, HCL Tech, M&M see heavy trading volumes amid market downturn
items.description: IT stocks continue to see strong selling pressure amid concerns surrounding US' slowing economy.

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex, Nifty at eight-month low in broad-based selling, IT and metal shares weigh
items.description: Except auto, pharma, FMCG, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with IT, metal, telecom indices down 2 percent. Nifty Midcap and smallcap indices shed 1 percent each.

items.title: Live: Nifty Staring At Worst Monthly Losing Streak In 28 Years| Midcap Rout Continues| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty breaks below crucial support level of 22,600. Nifty set for worst monthly losing streak in 28 years. Nifty on course for a five-month losing streak. Nifty, Sensex down 4% in Feb so far. US markets saw worst session of 2025 on Friday. Weak US data; sharp rise in long-term inflation expectations. Nvidia earnings, US PCE data this week. US futures are trading higher; Europe mixed. Midcap pain continues; NSE adv-dec ratio at 1:3. IT & metals big laggards today. Auto, FMCG & pharma among gainers. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: BSE, Angel One, other capital market stocks tumble up to 3% as bears reign over benchmarks
items.description: As markets continue to see a persistent decline, retail investors' interest could be on the wane, which is considered a negative for the capital market stocks

items.title: FMCG, pharma stocks defy market trend to trade in green as Nifty sinks to 8-month lows
items.description: All sectoral indices traded with sharp losses except the Nifty FMCG and Nifty Pharma gauges, that showed minor gains in a sea of red.

items.title: Glenmark Pharma shares rise over 3% on settlement of anti-trust and consumer protection lawsuits
items.description: The settlement is worth $7 million with the plaintiffs — Humana, Centene, and Kaiser — but the company continues ton emphasize on being not guilty of the claims.

items.title: Nifty Auto recovers 1% from day's low as concerns over Tesla's India entry ease
items.description: CLSA recently said that the entry of Elon Musk-led Tesla won't significantly impact the already existing automakers in the domestic market; Jefferies sees up to 53% potential upside for M&M stock

items.title: Inox India shares down 2% despite becoming first Indian firm to get cryogenic fuel tank certification
items.description: The certification was awarded following a comprehensive audit of INOX India's facility located in Kalol, in Panchmahal, Gujarat.

items.title: Nifty Bank drops 1%, extends losses for 3rd day as IndusInd, HDFC Bank shares lead decline
items.description: This comes amid a lower market sentiment, with most of the sectoral indices standing in the red.

items.title: Federal Bank: The journey is getting bigger, more profitable
items.description: Federal Bank has unveiled a transformation journey to leap to the top league of private sector banks

items.title: More than half of top 500 stocks saw over 20 percent fall in m-cap since September
items.description: Buying shares during a market decline can translate into higher compounding returns once the uptrend begins, however, risks of a further fall may still remain. From a longer term perspective, some experts believe the current levels may be suppressed, and could lead to strategic entry opportunities.

items.title: Agri Picks Report February 24, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The International Grains Council has scaled down its estimate for global production in 2024-25 by 3 million tonnes to 2,301 million tonnes, compared to its projections in January, according to a grain market report released Thursday.

items.title: InterGlobe Aviation shares surge for 6th day; Citi places stock on 90-day positive catalyst watch
items.description: InterGlobe Aviation continued its upward streak for the sixth consecutive session on February 24, rising to Rs 4,543 per share, marking a 7 percent gain over this period

items.title: Nomura sees Tesla boosting EV adoption, CLSA dismisses disruption fears
items.description: Tesla would need local manufacturing to scale effectively. Even with import duties below 20 percent, pricing vehicles under Rs 35-40 lakh would remain a challenge.

items.title: M&M shares gain nearly 2% as Jefferies maintains 'buy' call, sees over 50% upside
items.description: M&M share price: The brokerage finds M&M’s valuation attractive, noting that its core FY26 estimated price-to-earnings ratio of 20x supports an 18 percent EPS CAGR for FY25-27.

items.title: US markets: After initial gains, US markets trade in red as S&P 500 falls 0.5%, Dow Jones falls 0.17%
items.description: This week, US markets watchers will have their eyes on a slew of big name earnings announcements this week including global chipmaker NVIDIA. Other earnings this week include Lowes, Home Depot and Salesforce.com.
